GlooKit.GlooFramework

Class Button

  • java.lang.Object
    • GlooKit.GlooFramework.KitBit
      • GlooKit.GlooFramework.Button

  • public class Button
extends KitBit
    A Button is a KitBit that can perform an action when clicked on. A Button may actually have up to three different functions: an onClick() method that is activated when this Button is clicked (when the mouse is pressed and released over this Button), an onHover() method that is called every frame the mouse is over this Button, and an onMouseDown() method, which is triggered the first frame the mouse is pressed down on this Button. Button can be overridden and extended to allow for more complex behavior, if desired, including more actions.
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    KitBit

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      Boolean for whether this Button has been clicked (but not yet released)
      private java.lang.Runnable onHover
      Action to be called when the mouse is over this Button
      private java.lang.Runnable onMouseDown
      Action to be called when the mouse is initially pressed down on this Button

      • Button

        public Button(int X,
              int Y,
              java.lang.String W,
              java.lang.String H,
              Drawable frame,
              Label label,
              java.lang.Runnable onClick)
        Overloads the default Button constructor to take only an onClick() method and not an onHover() method or onMouseDown() method.
        Parameters:
        X - int of the horizontal justification, as defined in the KitBit class
        Y - int of the vertical justification, as defined in the KitBit class
        W - a valid formatting String for setting the width, as defined in the KitBit class
        H - a valid formatting String for setting the height, as defined in the KitBit class
        frame - a Drawable, which determines how to draw this object on the screen
        label - a Label, which handles the the text and formatting of text of this element
        onClick - a Runnable to be called when this Button is clicked

      • Button

        public Button(int X,
              int Y,
              java.lang.String W,
              java.lang.String H,
              Drawable frame,
              Label label,
              java.lang.Runnable onClick,
              java.lang.Runnable onHover,
              java.lang.Runnable onMouseDown)
        Constructs a Button given the normal parameters of the default KitBit constructor and a frame, a label, and up to three Runnables to be called when the Button is clicked, has the mouse over it, or when the mouse presses down on it. A Button does not have any children.
        Parameters:
        X - int of the horizontal justification, as defined in the KitBit class
        Y - int of the vertical justification, as defined in the KitBit class
        W - a valid formatting String for setting the width, as defined in the KitBit class
        H - a valid formatting String for setting the height, as defined in the KitBit class
        frame - a Drawable, which determines how to draw this object on the screen
        label - a Label, which handles the the text and formatting of text of this element
        onClick - a Runnable to be called when this Button is clicked
        onHover - a Runnable to be called when the mouse is over this Button
        onMouseDown - a Runnable to be called when the mouse is initially pressed down on this Button
        See Also:
        KitBit.KitBit(int, int, String, String)

    • Method Detail

      • activateOnHover

        public void activateOnHover()
        Calls the onHover() method of this Button, if there is any. This method should be overridden if the action is not a Runnable, but instead something like a Consumer or BiConsumer.

      • activateOnMouseDown

        public void activateOnMouseDown()
        Calls the onMouseDown() method of this Button, if there is any. This method should be overridden if the action is not a Runnable, but instead something like a Consumer or BiConsumer.

      • calcFrame

        public void calcFrame(double delta,
                      Input input)
        Overrides the calcFrame(double, Input) method of KitBit to check if the Button was moused over, pressed, or clicked since the last frame. Triggers the onHover() action every frame that the mouse is over this Button. Triggers the onMouseDown() action only the first frame that the mouse was pressed down. Triggers the onClick() action when the mouse has been pressed and released over this Button without moving off of it. This method can be overridden to change this behavior if desired.
        Overrides:
        calcFrame in class KitBit
        Parameters:
        delta - double for the number of seconds between the previous frame and the current frame
        input - an Input, which handles user input from keyboards, mice and controllers and is typically passed down by the parent of this KitBit
        See Also:
        KitBit.stepFrame(double)

      • setOnClick

        public void setOnClick(java.lang.Runnable onClick)
        Sets the onClick() method of this KitBit, which is a function that will be called when the Button is clicked. This method can be overridden to allow for more complex functions like Consumers and BiConsumers.
        Parameters:
        onClick - a Runnable to be called when this Button is clicked

      • setOnHover

        public void setOnHover(java.lang.Runnable onHover)
        Sets the onHover() method of this KitBit, which is a function called every frame the mouse is over this Button. This method can be overridden to allow for more complex functions like Consumers and BiConsumers.
        Parameters:
        onHover - a Runnable to be called when the mouse is over this Button

      • setOnMouseDown

        public void setOnMouseDown(java.lang.Runnable onMouseDown)
        Sets the onMouseDown() method of this KitBit, which is a function called the first frame the mouse is pressed down on this Button. This method can be overridden to allow for more complex functions like Consumers and BiConsumers.
        Parameters:
        onMouseDown - a Runnable to be called when the mouse is initially pressed down on this Button
